      • assignTransaction

        public void assignTransaction()
        Set this request's CommitOnlyTransaction. It does so based on whether its a local or a remote commit. This method must be called before making the CommitRequest visible to others: This way there is no race in the assignment of this request's transaction.

      • toString

      • handle

        public CommitRequest handle()
        Handles a commit request. This method is responsible for all the operations required to commit this request. In the end, the request will be marked either as committed or invalid. It may then be removed from the queue of commit requests. It will not be removed from the queue if there is no 'next' request. This is to ensure the invariant: There is always at least one request in the queue. This method never throws an exception. It catches all and always returns the next request to process.
        Returns:
        The next request to process, or null if there are no more records in line.

      • internalHandle

        protected void internalHandle()

      • getValidationStatus

        public CommitRequest.ValidationStatus getValidationStatus()

      • setInvalid

        public void setInvalid()
        Mark this commit request as invalid. More than one thread may attempt to set this status. Nevertheless, all threads that attempt it will have the same opinion.

      • setValid

        public void setValid()
        Mark this commit request as valid. More than one thread may attempt to set this status. Nevertheless, all threads that attempt it will have the same opinion.
